name: White Chocolate Cake with White Chocolate Icing

image.caption: White Chocolate Cake with White Chocolate Icing

description: This is a white chocolate cake with a white chocolate icing. I got this recipe from my mother and it's a beautiful, smooth cake, good for any occasion.
recipeIngredient: 4 ounces white chocolate, broken into small pieces
8 ounces white chocolate, melted and cooled

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Grease and flour three 8-inch round cake pans or line with parchment paper.

Place chopped white chocolate in the top of a double boiler over simmering water. Stir frequently, scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until chocolate is melted, about 5 minutes.
Cream sugar and butter together using an electric mixer until fluffy. Add 4 egg yolks, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Mix in vanilla extract and melted chocolate.
Combine flour, baking soda, and salt in another bowl. Blend into butter mixture, alternating with buttermilk, beating well after each addition.
Beat egg whites in a separate bowl until stiff; fold into batter. Pour batter evenly into the prepared cake pans.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of each layer comes out clean, 25 to 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool completely, about 30 minutes.
Combine melted white chocolate, confectioners' sugar, hot water, butter, egg yolks, vanilla extract, and salt in a mixing bowl; beat into a smooth icing using an electric mixer.
Place 1 cake layer on a serving plate. Cover with some frosting and another cake layer. Repeat once more. Frost the top and sides of the cake with the remaining icing.

aggregateRating.itemReviewed: White Chocolate Cake with White Chocolate Icing

review.reviewBody: I used 2 9” round pans. It was too much batter so one overflowed. Had to leave cake in the oven another 15 minutes. Ended up with one raw in the middle so I used the good layer and made a half batch of icing. It had a wonderful flavor and will make it again.

This recipe is identical,  except we used chocolate instead of white chocolate,  to a recipe my mother used to make when I was a child. The recipe was handed down to her from from family. I don't know the whole story. So, since the 1920's at least, this recipe has been around. I have made it a few times over the years. For me this is the only chocolate cake that matters. I have never  had any other chocolate cake that compared to this one.
